Title: First Lady lauds NDPHC boss over leadership of firm
Summary: Oluremi Tinubu lauds the Managing Director/Chief Executive Officer of the Niger Delta Power Holding Company (NDPHC), Jennifer Adighije, for her outstanding leadership and unwavering commitment to duty . The First Lady of the Federal Republic of Nigeria has commended the NDPHC boss .

Title: Botswana appoints Nigerian, Gumel, as SWF chairman
Summary: President of Botswana, Advocate Duma Gideon Boko, has announced the creation of a new Botswana Sovereign Wealth Fund Limited . A Nigerian, Farouk Gumel, has been appointed as the inaugural Chairman of its Board of Directors .

Title: Rivers’ workers protest against verification exercise order
Summary: Civil servants in Rivers State, at the weekend, staged a protest against the mandatory staff verification exercise . The exercise is a few days to the expiration of the emergency rule in the state .

Title: Bane of Nigeria’s economy: Borrowing, unproductivity, inflation and corruption
Summary: The Bane of Nigeria’s economy: Borrowing, unproductivity, inflation and corruption . Nigeria is often described as a country of great potential, but that potential remains largely unrealised .

Title: RMAFC’s plan to raise politicians’ salaries unrealistic, inequitable
Summary: The plan by the Revenue Mobilisation Allocation and Fiscal Commission (RMAFC) is both unrealistic and ill-timed . Despite RMAFC’s fine argument,   the plan is  unfairly and ineffective .

Title: Niger govt demands clerics submit sermons for approval
Summary: Earlier this month, Umar Farooq, head of Niger State Religious Affairs, said clerics must obtain licences within two months . The head of the state religious affairs said clerics had to obtain licences in order to get the licence .

Title: FG targets 25% industry share of GDP by 2035
Summary: FG targets 25% industry share of GDP by 2035 . Minister of State for Industry, Senator John Owan, disclosed the plan at the Gastech Exhibition and Conference .

Title: How to use AI to get a high-paying job in 2025
Summary: Landing a high-paying job has never been more competitive, but artificial intelligence (AI) is changing the game . How to use AI to get a job in 2025?

Title: Afreximbank launches company to promote large -scale intra African trade
Summary: African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) has launched the African Trade and Distribution Company (ATDC) ATDC is to catalyse large-scale trade in raw materials, minerals and value-added products from across Africa . Title: Business start-ups in Nigeria on 3-year downward trend — Report
Summary: The 2024 State of Entrepreneurship (SoE) Report just released by Fate Foundation, a non-profit private-sector led organisation, shows that the business birth rate in Nigeria fell . •Dips to 24% in 2024 in the report .

Title: BBN drama: Big Soso blasts Dede as selfish, explains explosive fight

Title: NiMet predicts three-day thunderstorms, rainfall nationwide
Summary: Nigerian Meteorological Agency has forecast thunderstorms and rainfall across the country from Monday to Wednesday . NiMet’s weather outlook, released on Sunday in Abuja, predicted isolated thunderstorms with moderate rains on Monday morning over Kaduna, Gombe, Bauchi, Kebbi, and Taraba states .

Title: Fidelity Bank spotlights fintech’s role in US-Africa trade
Summary: Fidelity Bank Plc will be hosting a panel session titled ‘Digital Railroads: Powering U.S.–Africa Commerce Through Fintech’ at the upcoming Fidelity Nigeria International Trade and Creative Connect in Atlanta, USA . The session will explore how fintech is reshaping cross-border trade by enabling

Title: Two feared killed in Lagos suspected cult attacks
Summary: Residents of Lakowe’s Orita Adeba and Sangotedo were on edge Saturday as suspected cult clashes left two young men brutally killed in separate suspected reprisals . PUNCH Metro gathered on Sunday that the incidents were the latest in a string of cult-related clashes that have claimed several lives across Lagos State

Title: Eno revives Akwa Ibom inter-school competitions
Summary: Governor, Umo Eno gave the directives at the closing/medal presentation ceremony of the Akwa Ibom Sports Festival . He described sports as a multi-billion-dollar global industry and one of the cardinal points of the tourism drive of his administration .
